newsitem.title: USA: Herley wins $2.3 mln U.S. Navy contract.
newsitem.headline: Herley wins $2.3 mln U.S. Navy contract.

text.p: Herley Industries Inc said Wednesday it received a contract valued at $2.3 million from the U.S. Navy for the DSQ-37 Scoring System.

This is the standard doppler scoring system used by the Navy at all ranges for testing and training purposes, the company said, noting its Herley-Vega Systems division has been building the DSQ-37 since 1992, and this four-year contract will make it the Navy supplier past the year 2000.
If the Navy exercises all options, they will order almost 200 units at a value of about $2.3 million, the company said.

"Coupled with the $3,900,000 award of the DPN-90 Beacon Transponder a week ago, (Herley-Vega) will retain its position as a leading supplier of flight instrumentation products to Navy training ranges well past the year 2000," Herley said.
